Volatility Engine

The VolatilityEngine class is responsible for managing volatility surface calculations and analysis for option markets.

class core.VolatilityEngine.VolPoints(timestamp)[source]

Bases: object

add_point(point)[source]

Add a volatility point to the surface.

Parameters:

point (VolatilityPoint) – The VolatilityPoint to add.

class core.VolatilityEngine.VolatilityEngine(min_points=10, length=100)[source]

Bases: object

add_market_data(timestamp, strike, moneyness, option_type, expiry_date, days_to_expiry, implied_vol, delta=None, gamma=None, vega=None, theta=None, snapshot_id=None, asset_id=None)[source]
get_implied_volatility_index(surface, target_expiry_days=30)[source]

Get the implied volatility index for the surface.

Parameters:

  • surface (VolSurface) – VolSurface object containing the volatility surface data

  • target_expiry_days (int) – Target number of days to expiry (default: 30)

Returns:

The implied volatility index, or None if surface is invalid

Return type:

float

get_latest_snapshot_id()[source]

Fetches the latest snapshot_id from the most recent timestamp.

Return type:

Optional[str]

Returns:

The latest snapshot_id or None if no data is available.

get_skews(surface)[source]

Get the volatility skews for each expiry.

Parameters:

surface (VolSurface) – VolSurface object containing the volatility surface data

Return type:

DataFrame

Returns:

A DataFrame containing the skew data or None if insufficient data

get_surface_metrics(surface)[source]

Calculate key surface metrics.

Parameters:

surface (VolSurface) – VolSurface object containing the volatility surface data

Returns:

A dictionary containing various metrics of the volatility surface

Return type:

Dict

get_volatility_surface(snapshot_id, asset_id)[source]

Create a VolSurface object containing implied volatilities with strikes and days to expiry.

Parameters:

  • snapshot_id (str) – The snapshot_id to create the VolSurface from.

  • asset_id (str) – The asset_id to create the VolSurface from.

Return type:

Optional[VolSurface]

Returns:

A VolSurface object representing the volatility surface
